TopicDetails.title: EIC Accelerator Open 2021

types.typeOfAction: HORIZON-EIC-ACC-BF HORIZON EIC Accelerator Blended Finance

3310274.action: HORIZON-EIC-2021-ACCELERATOROPEN-01 - HORIZON-EIC-ACC-BF HORIZON EIC Accelerator Blended Finance

TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

The EIC Accelerator supports companies (principally start-ups and SMEs) to scale up high impact innovations with the potential to create new markets or disrupt existing ones. The EIC Accelerator provides a unique combination of funding from EUR 0.5 to EUR 17.5 million and Business Acceleration Services (see Chapter V of the EIC Work Programme 2021).

The EIC Accelerator focuses in particular on innovations building on scientific discovery or technological breakthroughs (‘deep tech’) and where significant funding is needed over a long timeframe before returns can be generated (‘patient capital’). Such innovations often struggle to attract financing because the risks and time period involved are too high. Funding and support from the EIC Accelerator is designed to enable such innovators to attract the full investment amounts needed for scale up in a shorter timeframe.

The EIC Accelerator is open to innovations in any field of technology or application. However, innovations that harm the environment or social welfare or that are designed primarily for military applications will not be supported.

The EIC Accelerator supports the later stages of technology development as well as scale-up. The technology component of your innovation must therefore have been tested and validated in a laboratory or other relevant environment (e.g. at least Technology Readiness Level 5/6 or higher). The EIC Accelerator looks to support companies where the EIC support will act as a catalyst to crowd in other investors necessary for the scaleup of the innovation.

For further information, please see the EIC Work Programme 2021

<p><b><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">1. Admissibility conditions:</span></b><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"> In order to apply you must meet one of the following eligibility conditions:</span><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB"> </span></p>
<ul>
    <li><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
     Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
     EN-GB">A single company classified as a SME and established within a      Member State or an Associated Country (see <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf" target="_blank"><span style="color:blue">Annex 3 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</span></a>);</span></li>
    <li><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
     Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
     EN-GB">A single company classified as a ‘Small mid-cap’ (up to 500      employees) established in a Member State or an Associated Country, but      your application can only be for rapid scale up purposes (e.g. Technology      Readiness Level 9) and only for the investment component;</span></li>
    <li><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:
     Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;mso-fareast-language:
     EN-GB">One or more natural persons (including individual entrepreneurs) or      legal entities, which are either:</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="margin-left: 80px;"><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">a.     </span><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">from a Member State or an Associated Country (for Associated Countries other than EEA, this possibility will be subject to the related association agreements) intending to establish an SME or small mid-cap (as defined above) in a Member State or Associated Country by the time of signing the Accelerator contract or, in the case blended finance is awarded, at the latest when agreeing on its investment component;</span></p>
<p style="margin-left: 80px;"><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">b.     intending to invest in an SME or small mid-cap in a Member State or an Associated Country and who may submit a proposal on behalf of that SME or small mid-cap, provided that a prior agreement exist with the company. The contract will be signed with the beneficiary company only;</span></p>
<p style="margin-left: 80px;"><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">c.     from a non-associated third country intending to establish an SME (including start-ups) or to relocate an existing SME to a Member State or an Associated Country, by the time of submitting a full application. Your company must prove its effective establishment in a Member State or an Associated Country. The Commission may set specific conditions and milestones in the contract to ensure that the interest of the Union is met.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;margin-bottom:0cm;margin-bottom:
.0001pt;text-align:justify;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none"><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">The standard admissibility and eligibility conditions are detailed in <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf"><span style="color:blue">Annex 2</span></a> and information on eligible Associated Countries in <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf"><span style="color:blue">Annex 3 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</span></a>.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;margin-bottom:0cm;margin-bottom:
.0001pt;text-align:justify;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none"><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">There are limitations on the number of times you can submit an application described in the <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf" target="_blank">section II.3 (Table 5) of the EIC Work Programme 2021</a> on resubmission</span><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-fareast-language:
EN-GB"> <span style="color:black">limits.</span></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;margin-bottom:0cm;margin-bottom:
.0001pt;text-align:justify;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none"><span style="mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;color:black;
mso-fareast-language:EN-GB">If you are currently a participant in an eligible project funded by <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">Horizon Europe</b> or <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">Horizon 2020</b> then you may be able to apply through your existing project under the <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">Fast Track scheme</b> (see <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf"><span style="color:blue">Annex 4 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</span></a>). This scheme is managed by the funding body responsible for the existing project and for 2021 it applies to funding bodies managing grants under the <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">EIC Pathfinder</b> and <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">Transition</b> (including <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">EIC pilot 2018-20</b>); <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">ERC Proof of Concept</b>; and <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">Knowledge and Innovation Communities (KICs)</b> supported by the <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:normal">European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT)</b>. Applicants may also be able to apply if they have a project financed by an eligible programme managed by a Member State or an Associated Country under the pilot <b style="mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal">Plug-in scheme</b>. The Plug-in scheme to apply to the EIC Accelerator is detailed in <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf"><span style="color:blue">Annex 5 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</span></a>.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt:auto;margin-bottom:0cm;margin-bottom:
.0001pt;text-align:justify;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:none;
text-autospace:none"> </p>
<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Proposal page limits and layout:</span></strong> <span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">You must prepare your application (Short and Full application) on the EIC artificial intelligence-based IT platform via on-line forms, by answering a series of questions:</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Short applications:</span></strong></p>
<ul>
    <li><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">An on-line form where you must summarise your proposal and respond to a set of questions on your innovation, your potential market and your team;</span></li>
    <li><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">A pitch-deck of up to 10 slides following a set format;</span></li>
    <li><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">A (link to a) video pitch of up to 3 minutes where the core members of your team (up to three people) should provide the motivation for your application.</span></li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal"><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Full applications:</span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin"> </span></p>
<ul>
    <li><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">An on-line form that follows a methodology embedded in the EIC artificial intelligence-based IT platform that produces a full and detailed business plan with information on you company’s finances and structur; </span></li>
    <li><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">A pitch-deck to be used if invited to the interviews</span></li>
</ul>
<p> </p>

<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">2. Eligible countries:</span></strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin"> described in section II.3 and in <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf" target="_blank">Annex 3 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</a>.</span></p>
<p><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">Applicants from the United Kingdom can apply to the EIC Accelerator, but can only request and receive funding in the form of “grant only”. The signature of any grant agreement will be subject to the positive conclusion of the association negotiation with the United Kingdom.</span></p>
<p> </p>

<p><strong><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:Calibri;mso-bidi-theme-font:
minor-latin">4. Evaluation and award:</span></strong></p>
<ul>
    <li><strong>Award criteria, scoring and thresholds:</strong> described in <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf" target="_blank">section II.3 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</a></li>
    <li><strong>Submission and evaluation processes:</strong> described in <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf" target="_blank">section II.3 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</a></li>
    <li><strong>Indicative timeline for evaluation and grant agreement:</strong> described in <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf" target="_blank">section II.3 of the EIC Work Programme 2021</a></li>
</ul>
<p> </p>




<p><strong>Call document and annexes:</strong><br />
<a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/horizon/wp-call/2021/wp_horizon-eic-2021_en.pdf" target="_blank">EIC Work Programme 2021</a><br />
<a href="https://eic.ec.europa.eu/guide-applicants_en" target="_blank">  Guide for Applicants</a><br />
<a href="https://eic.ec.europa.eu/eic-frequently-asked-questions_en#ecl-inpage-348" target="_blank">Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)</a><br />
<a href="https://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/common/agr-contr/general-mga_horizon-euratom_en.pdf" target="_blank">MGA used for EIC actions under Horizon Europe (HE General MGA)<br />
</a><a href="https://eic.ec.europa.eu/system/files/2021-05/EIC%20Fund%20Investment%20Guidelines%20-%20Horizon%20Europe.pdf" target="_blank">EIC Fund Investment Guidelines</a></p>
<p><strong>Additional documents:</strong><br />
<a href="http://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/ALL/?uri=CELEX:32018R1046&qid=1535046024012" target="_blank">EU Financial Regulation 2018/1046</a><br />
<a href="http://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/common/guidance/rules-lev-lear-fca_en.pdf" target="_blank">Rules for Legal Entity Validation, LEAR Appointment and Financial Capacity Assessment</a><br />
<a href="http://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/common/guidance/om_en.pdf" target="_blank">Funding & Tenders Portal Online Manual</a><br />
<a href="http://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/common/ftp/tc_en.pdf" target="_blank">Funding & Tenders Portal Terms & Conditions</a><br />
<a href="http://ec.europa.eu/info/funding-tenders/opportunities/docs/2021-2027/common/ftp/privacy-statement_en.pdf" target="_blank">Funding & Tenders Portal Privacy Statement</a></p>
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
Online Manual is your guide on the procedures from proposal submission to managing your grant.

Horizon Europe Programme Guide contains the detailed guidance to the structure, budget and political priorities of Horizon Europe.

Funding & Tenders Portal FAQ – find the answers to most frequently asked questions on submission of proposals, evaluation and grant management.

Research Enquiry Service – ask questions about any aspect of European research in general and the EU Research Framework Programmes in particular.

Enterprise Europe Network – contact your EEN national contact for advice to businesses with special focus on SMEs. The support includes guidance on the EU research funding.

EIC Accelerator Helpdesk – contact the dedicated helpdesk for call related questions and technical aspects of submission of proposals in the EIC AI platform

IT Helpdesk – contact the Funding & Tenders Portal IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, etc.

European IPR Helpdesk assists you on intellectual property issues.

CEN and CENELEC, the European Standards Organisations advise you how to tackle standardisation in your project proposal. Contact CEN-CENELEC Research Helpdesk at research@cencenelec.eu.

The European Charter for Researchers and the Code of Conduct for their recruitment – consult the general principles and requirements specifying the roles, responsibilities and entitlements of researchers, employers and funders of researchers.

National Contact Points Network - The page includes the list of NCPs appointed for HORIZON 2020. It will soon be updated once the NCPs for HORIZON EUROPE are nominated

Partner Search Services help you find a partner organisation for your proposal.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service, please click on the submission-button next to the type of action and the type of model grant agreement that corresponds to your proposal. You will then be asked to confirm your choice, as it cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation, you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Funding & Tenders Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

latestInfos.content:
• The AI platform is fully open and Step 1 applications may be submitted at any time (no deadlines). Please be aware that for short applications submitted less than 6 weeks before a cut-off (if successful), you may face time constraints in the preparation of the full application for the subsequent cut-off date.
  • Please be informed that new Step 1 functionalities will be available on the AI platform as from June 22nd.
  • Those of you receiving positive Step 1 evaluation results before the June cut-off you will have the possibility to benefit from the coaching services for the preparation of the full proposal.
The first deadline (cut-off) date for the EIC Accelerator Open 2021 (09 June) has been postponed by a week. The new deadline (cut-off) date is 16 June 2021 17:00:00 Brussels time.
The submission session is now available for: HORIZON-EIC-2021-ACCELERATOROPEN-01(HORIZON-EIC-ACC-BF)
